intro: Sutera natalensis, commonly known as Natal nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Sutera natalensis is often found in rocky or coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
